item.title: Report X-2024081398
item.description:
Report X-2024081398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE AND UPON ARRIVAL MULTIPLE PACKAGES WERE AFFECTED BY A LEAKING PACKAGE. THIS PACKAGE WAS AFFECTED BY A NON-HAZARDOUS LEAKING PACKAGE. ONCE THIS PACKAGES WAS OPENED, EMPLOYEE NOTICED PACKAGE HAD 19 PACKAGES OF AMMO AND A LOADED MAG OF AMMO. OUTER PACKAGING HAD NO LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND LABEL ON THE PACKAGING. REWRAP; PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON; NO DAMAGE TO AMMUNITION

item.title: Report I-2024080044
item.description:
Report I-2024080044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: LAKE HAVASU CITY
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ECOLOGY CONTROL INDUSTRIES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11th, 2024 I drove a load from Marathon Refinery in Carson, CA to Foreman, AR. When I reached Lake Havasa, AZ it was a temperature of 125 degrees F. I reached the truck stop Pilots in Lake Havasa to take a 30 minute break and did a trailer inspection on the trailer 1145. I noticed the trailer was leaking the product out of the top of the tank. I rushed to grab some trash cans that the truck stop had next to my trailer to catch any liquid that was draining down the side of the tank. I climbed up the ladder to inspect where the leak was coming from and noticed it was leaking from the ARV Valve and also had 40 PSI of pressure and nowhere to relieve the pressure from. I cleaned up the tank and kept an eye on it and waited for temps to cool down. Once the temps cooled down I was able to relieve the pressure from the domes by cracking one of the ears. All the pressure was relieved and the leak stopped and was contained until the HAZMAT team showed up at 0900 in the morning to clean up.
